result.execSummary:
The defendant Don R. Knueppel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Any other counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don R. Knueppel

records.addlTxt: 21CF227 & 22CF41 Cases called @ 1:35 PM Defendant Don R. Knueppel in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of his right to counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing in both cases. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing in both cases. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: 21CF227: Ct 1 - NC. 22CF41: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF227: Ct 2 - DRI. 22CF41: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: As to 21CF227 only - 68 days WC Jail - 68 days CFTS - Time served sentence. As to both cases - AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied.  Appeal rights given.
Inmate Request to court for bond modification - Court will address at next hearing

Cases 22CF41 & 21CF227 called @ 2:45 PM Defendant Don R. Knueppel in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD services but an attorney has not yet been appointed. Defendant waives his right to counsel to discuss possible resolution with DA. Recess for parties to discuss. Case recalled @ 2:50 PM: same appearance. The parties have reached an agreement and request a P/S Hearing
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Blankschein confirms receipt. DE is eligible for SPD represenation. Bond arguments by counsel. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court sets $2000 cash bond ordered w/counsel.
